member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of groups (categories) to produce when either BaseUnit is set to Fit or BaseUnitStep is set to 0 (auto). This option is ignored in all other cases.

member.name: P:Kendo.Mvc.UI.ChartCategoryAxis`1.RoundToBaseUnit
member.summary: If set to false, the min and max dates will not be rounded off to the nearest baseUnit. This option is most useful in combination with explicit min and max dates. It will be ignored if either Bar, Column, OHLC or Candlestick series are plotted on the axis.
member.value: A boolean value that indicates if the axis range should be rounded to the nearest base unit. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Kendo.Mvc.UI.ChartCategoryAxis`1.Justified
member.summary: Positions categories and series points on major ticks. This removes the empty space before and after the series. This option will be ignored if either Bar, Column, OHLC or Candlestick series are plotted on the axis.

member.name: P:Kendo.Mvc.UI.ChartCategoryAxis`1.AutoBaseUnitSteps
member.summary: Specifies the discrete BaseUnitStep values when either BaseUnit is set to Fit or BaseUnitStep is set to 0 (auto).

member.summary: Specifies the date category axis minimum (start) date.

member.name: P:Kendo.Mvc.UI.IChartCategoryAxis.RoundToBaseUnit
member.summary: If set to false, the min and max dates will not be rounded off to the nearest baseUnit. This option is most useful in combination with explicit min and max dates. It will be ignored if either Bar, Column, OHLC or Candlestick series are plotted on the axis.

member.name: P:Kendo.Mvc.UI.IChartCategoryAxis.Justified
member.summary: Positions categories and series points on major ticks. This removes the empty space before and after the series. This option will be ignored if either Bar, Column, OHLC or Candlestick series are plotted on the axis.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartAxisBaseUnitStepsBuilder.Minutes(System.Int32[])
member.summary: The discrete BaseUnitStep values when BaseUnit is set to Minutes and BaseUnitStep is set to 0 (auto).
member.param: The discrete steps when BaseUnit is set to Minutes.

example.code:
<% Html.Kendo().Chart()
            .Name("chart")
            .Title("Units sold")
            .Series(series => {
            series
            .Column(new int[] { 20, 40, 45, 30, 50 });
            })
            .CategoryAxis(axis => axis
            .Date()
            .BaseUnit(ChartAxisBaseUnit.Fit)
            .AutoBaseUnitSteps(steps => steps.Minutes(1, 2))
            )
            %>

member.summary: Sets the tooltip template
member.value:
A client-side template for the tooltip.
Available template variables:
value - the point value
category - the category name
series - the data series configuration object
dataItem - the original data item (client-side binding only)
member.remarks: The format string is ignored if a template is set.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartDateCategoryAxisBuilder`1.BaseUnitStep(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the step (interval) between categories in base units. Specifiying 0 (auto) will set the step to such value that the total number of categories does not exceed MaxDateGroups.
member.remarks: This option is ignored if baseUnit is set to "fit".
member.param: the step (interval) between categories in base units. Set 0 for automatic step. The default value is 1.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartDateCategoryAxisBuilder`1.MaxDateGroups(System.Int32)
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of groups (categories) that the chart will attempt to produce when either BaseUnit is set to Fit or BaseUnitStep is set to 0 (auto). This option is ignored in all other cases.
member.param: the maximum number of groups (categories). The default value is 10.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartDateCategoryAxisBuilder`1.RoundToBaseUnit(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set to false, the min and max dates will not be rounded off to the nearest baseUnit. This option is most useful in combination with explicit min and max dates. It will be ignored if either Bar, Column, OHLC or Candlestick series are plotted on the axis.
member.param: A boolean value that indicates if the axis range should be rounded to the nearest base unit. The default value is true.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartDateCategoryAxisBuilder`1.Justify(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Positions categories and series points on major ticks. This removes the empty space before and after the series. This option will be ignored if either Bar, Column, OHLC or Candlestick series are plotted on the axis.
member.param: A boolean value that indicates if the empty space before and after the series should be removed. The default value is false.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartDateCategoryAxisBuilder`1.Justify
member.summary: Positions categories and series points on major ticks. This removes the empty space before and after the series. This option will be ignored if either Bar, Column, OHLC or Candlestick series are plotted on the axis.

member.summary: Configures the bubble chart behavior for negative values. By default negative values are not visible.

example.code:
<%= Html.Kendo().Chart()
            .Name("Chart")
            .Series(series => series
            .Bubble(s => s.x, s => s.y, s => s.size)
            .NegativeValues(n => n
            .Visible(true)
            );
            )
            %>

            .Series(series => series
            .Bubble(s => s.x, s => s.y, s => s.size)
            .Border(1, "Red");
            )
            .Render();
            %>

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets or sets the series.

member.summary: Sets the series title displayed in the legend.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartSeriesBuilderBase`2.GroupNameTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the name template for auto-generated series when binding to grouped data.
member.param: The name template for auto-generated series when binding to grouped data.

example.code: <% Html.Kendo().Chart() .Name("Chart") .DataSource(dataSource => dataSource .Read(read => read.Action("_StockData", "Scatter_Charts")) .Group(group => group.Add(model => model.Symbol))) ) .Series(series => series.Bar(s => s.Sales) .Name("Sales") .GroupNameTemplate("#= series.name # for #= group.field # #= group.value #") ) .Render(); %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartSeriesBuilderBase`2.Opacity(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the series opacity.
member.param: The series opacity in the range from 0 (transparent) to 1 (opaque). The default value is 1.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartSeriesBuilderBase`2.Color(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the bar fill color

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartSeriesBuilderBase`2.Tooltip(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartTooltipBuilder})

member.param: Use the configurator to set data tooltip options.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartSeriesBuilderBase`2.Tooltip(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the data point tooltip visibility.
member.param: A value indicating if the data point tooltip should be displayed. The tooltip is not visible by default.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.ChartSeriesBuilderBase`2.Axis(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the axis name to use for this series.
member.param: The axis name for this series.

example.code: <%= Html.Kendo().Chart(Model) .Name("Chart") .Series(series => series.Bar(s => s.Sales).Name("Sales").Axis("secondary")) .ValueAxis(axis => axis.Numeric()) .ValueAxis(axis => axis.Numeric("secondary")) .CategoryAxis(axis => axis.AxisCrossingValue(0, 10)) %>

member.summary: Sets the border opacity

example.code:
<%= Html.Kendo().StockChart(Model)
            .Name("Chart")
            .Navigator(nav => nav
            .Series(series =>
            {
            series.Bar(s => s.SalesAmount);
            })
            .Hint(hint => hint
            .Template("From: #= from # To: #= to #")
            )
            )
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.TreeViewBuilder.BindTo``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.TreeViewItem,``0})
member.summary: Binds the TreeView to a list of objects. The TreeView will be "flat" which means a TreeView item will be created for every item in the data source.
member.typeparam: The type of the data item
member.param: The action executed for every data bound item.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.TreeViewBuilder.BindTo(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.NavigationBindingFactory{Kendo.Mvc.UI.TreeViewItem}})
member.summary: Binds the TreeView to a list of objects. The TreeView will create a hierarchy of items using the specified mappings.
member.typeparam: The type of the data item
member.param: The action which will configure the mappings

example.code: <%= Html.Kendo().TreeView() .Name("TreeView") .BindTo(Model, mapping => mapping .For<Customer>(binding => binding .Children(c => c.Orders) // The "child" items will be bound to the the "Orders" property .ItemDataBound((item, c) => item.Text = c.ContactName) // Map "Customer" properties to TreeViewItem properties ) .For<Order<(binding => binding .Children(o => null) // "Orders" do not have child objects so return "null" .ItemDataBound((item, o) => item.Text = o.OrderID.ToString()) // Map "Order" properties to TreeViewItem properties ) ) %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridBuilder`1.BindTo(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0})
member.summary: Binds the grid to a list of objects

example.code:
<%= Html.Kendo().Grid<Order>()
            .Name("Orders")
            .Columns(columns=>
            {
            columns.Add(c => c.OrderID).Width(100);
            columns.Add(c => c.OrderDate).Width(200).Format("{0:dd/MM/yyyy}");
            columns.Add(c => c.ShipAddress);
            columns.Add(c => c.ShipCity).Width(200);
            })
            .BindTo((IEnumerable<Order>)ViewData["Orders"]);
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridBuilder`1.RowAction(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.GridRow{`0}})
member.summary: Callback for each row.
member.param: Action, which will be executed for each row. You can format the entire row

example.code:
<%= Html.Kendo().Grid()
            .Name("Grid")
            .RowAction(row =>
            {
            // "DataItem" is the Order object to which the current row is bound to
            if (row.DataItem.Freight > 10)
            {
            //Set the background of the entire row
            row.HtmlAttributes["style"] = "background:red;";
            }
            });
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridBuilder`1.CellAction(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.GridCell{`0}})
member.summary: Callback for each cell.
member.param: Action, which will be executed for each cell. You can format a concrete cell.

example.code:
<%= Html.Kendo().Grid()
            .Name("Grid")
            .CellAction(cell =>
            {
            if (cell.Column.Name == "Freight")
            {
            if (cell.DataItem.Freight > 10)
            {
            //Set the background of this cell only
            cell.HtmlAttributes["style"] = "background:red;";
            }
            }
            });
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridBuilder`1.EnableCustomBinding(System.Boolean)

            columns.Add(c => c.ShipAddress);

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridBuilder`1.Sortable(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridSortSettingsBuilder{`0}})
member.summary: Allows sorting of the columns.
member.param: Use builder to define sort settings.

example.code:
<%= Html.Kendo().Grid()
            .Name("Grid")
            .Columns(columns=>
            {
            columns.Add(c => c.OrderID).Width(100);
            columns.Add(c => c.OrderDate).Width(200).Format("{0:dd/MM/yyyy}");
            columns.Add(c => c.ShipAddress);
            columns.Add(c => c.ShipCity).Width(200);
            })
            .BindTo((IEnumerable<Order>)ViewData["Orders"])
            .Sortable(sorting => sorting.SortMode(GridSortMode.MultipleColumn)
            %>

<%= Html.Kendo().Grid()
            .Name("Grid")
            .Columns(columns=>
            {
            columns.Add(c => c.OrderID).Width(100);
            columns.Add(c => c.OrderDate).Width(200).Format("{0:dd/MM/yyyy}");
            columns.Add(c => c.ShipAddress);
            columns.Add(c => c.ShipCity).Width(200);
            })
            .BindTo((IEnumerable<Order>)ViewData["Orders"])
            .Navigatable();
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridBuilder`1.Navigatable(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridNavigatableSettingsBuilder})
member.summary: Enables keyboard navigation.

example.code:
<%= Html.Kendo().Grid()
            .Name("Grid")
            .Columns(columns=>
            {
            columns.Add(c => c.OrderID).Width(100);
            columns.Add(c => c.OrderDate).Width(200).Format("{0:dd/MM/yyyy}");
            columns.Add(c => c.ShipAddress);
            columns.Add(c => c.ShipCity).Width(200);
            })
            .BindTo((IEnumerable<Order>)ViewData["Orders"])
            .Navigatable(navigation => navigation.Enabled(true));
            %>

member.summary: Binds the menu to a list of objects. The menu will be "flat" which means a menu item will be created for every item in the data source.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.MenuBuilder.BindTo(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.NavigationBindingFactory{Kendo.Mvc.UI.MenuItem}})
member.summary: Binds the menu to a list of objects. The menu will create a hierarchy of items using the specified mappings.
member.typeparam: The type of the data item
member.param: The action which will configure the mappings

example.code: <%= Html.Kendo().Menu() .Name("Menu") .BindTo(Model, mapping => mapping .For<Customer>(binding => binding .Children(c => c.Orders) // The "child" items will be bound to the the "Orders" property .ItemDataBound((item, c) => item.Text = c.ContactName) // Map "Customer" properties to MenuItem properties ) .For<Order<(binding => binding .Children(o => null) // "Orders" do not have child objects so return "null" .ItemDataBound((item, o) => item.Text = o.OrderID.ToString()) // Map "Order" properties to MenuItem properties ) ) %>

            firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 2");
            });
            })
            %>

member.summary: Binds the panelbar to a list of objects
member.typeparam: The type of the data item
member.param: The action executed for every data bound item.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.PanelBarBuilder.BindTo(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.NavigationBindingFactory{Kendo.Mvc.UI.PanelBarItem}})
member.summary: Binds the panelbar to a list of objects. The panelbar will create a hierarchy of items using the specified mappings.
member.typeparam: The type of the data item
member.param: The action which will configure the mappings

example.code: <%= Html.Kendo().PanelBar() .Name("PanelBar") .BindTo(Model, mapping => mapping .For<Customer>(binding => binding .Children(c => c.Orders) // The "child" items will be bound to the the "Orders" property .ItemDataBound((item, c) => item.Text = c.ContactName) // Map "Customer" properties to PanelBarItem properties ) .For<Order<(binding => binding .Children(o => null) // "Orders" do not have child objects so return "null" .ItemDataBound((item, o) => item.Text = o.OrderID.ToString()) // Map "Order" properties to PanelBarItem properties ) ) %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.PanelBarItemBuilder.#ctor(Kendo.Mvc.UI.PanelBarItem,System.Web.Mvc.ViewContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.PanelBarItemBuilder.Items(System.Action{Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.PanelBarItemFactory})
member.summary: Configures the child items of a .

example.code:
<%= Html.Kendo().PanelBar()
            .Name("PanelBar")
            .Items(items =>
            {
            items.Add().Text("First Item").Items(firstItemChildren =>
            {
            firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 1");
            firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 2");
            });
            })
            %>

member.name: M:Kendo.Mvc.UI.Fluent.PanelBarItemBuilder.Expanded(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Define when the item will be expanded on intial render.
member.param: If true the item will be expanded.

example.code:
<%= Html.Kendo().PanelBar()
            .Name("PanelBar")
            .Items(items =>
            {
            items.Add().Text("First Item").Items(firstItemChildren =>
            {
            firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 1");
            firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 2");
            })
            .Expanded(true);
            })
            %>
